meanings.definition: The internal framework of bones in the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor studied the skeleton to learn about the person's health.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a dinosaur skeleton for visitors to see.
meanings.sent3: The skeleton at the museum decided to take a break and sit down.
meanings.sent4: The skeleton of the old building revealed its history through the cracks.
meanings.sent5: The skeleton in the science class made the students curious about anatomy.

meanings.definition: A very basic or minimal version of something.
meanings.sent1: The outline was just a skeleton of the final project.
meanings.sent2: She presented a skeleton of her plan before adding details.
meanings.sent3: The skeleton of the story left out all the exciting parts.
meanings.sent4: The skeleton of the song was catchy even without lyrics.
meanings.sent5: The skeleton of the design showed the main structure clearly.

meanings.definition: The supporting structure of a building or object.
meanings.sent1: The steel beams formed the skeleton of the skyscraper.
meanings.sent2: The wooden frame served as the skeleton for the new house.
meanings.sent3: The skeleton of the chair creaked under the weight of the person.
meanings.sent4: The skeleton of the ship kept it sturdy during rough seas.
meanings.sent5: The skeleton of the bridge provided strength and stability.
